content: Christophe Hauser | Department of Computer Science Skip to main content Christophe Hauser Assistant Professor Appointments Assistant Professor Faculty Member, Institute for Security, Technology and Society Binary program analysis/reverse engineering/vulnerability discovery Biography I specialize in software security and build models to reason about new cyber attacks and defenses across the software stack and hardware boundaries. My work is at the intersection of program analysis, formal methods and machine learning with applications to reverse engineering and vulnerability discovery and a focus on binary code and firmware. My research interests also include intrusion detection, usable security and privacy-preserving systems. Please visit my personal page for more information. View More Education M.S.
